statement.tex: \text{A balloon, which always remains spherical on inflation,}\\ \text{is being inflated by pumping in gas at 900 cm$^3$/s. Find}\\ \text{the rate at which the radius of the balloon is increasing}\\ \text{when the radius is 15 cm.}

step.tex: \text{Find }\frac{dR}{dt}\text{ when V = 900 cm$^3$}\\ \text{where V = balloon's volume and R = it's radius}
step.reason: \text{If the units of V are cm$^3$, then cm$^3$/s must be }\frac{dV}{dt}.\\ \text{In other words, 900 cm$^3$/s = $\dfrac{dV}{dt}$.
\text{Check the calculations if you got them wrong. Moreover,}\\ \text{notice that the units of }\frac{dR}{dt}\text{ should be cm/s.}
